channel.title: Help making new armour
channel.description: I get the general idea of what to do. but could someone give me a step by step tutorial to help walk my through it? I know how to make the armour, I just don't know how to make it wearable, and not have any problems once on the server.

item.description:
@Tobbo88 wrote:

mine went online and worked then fked up when tried to run again i only added 1 sprite i seen somewhere about someone havin isues goin over 250 on animations think its the same thing

Read full topic

item.title: Help making new armour
item.dc:creator: @TannerRSC TannerRSC
item.description:
@TannerRSC wrote:

About the sprites part

the number between is the exact location of the thing in animations.rscd

let’s say, your items specs are added on the 200th spot on animations.rscd. The the sprite number will say 200.

You can check this by multiplying your sprite number with 8 and going to that line in animations.rscd, there you’ll see that the item corresponds, e.g shields will have squareshield in animations.rscd

Read full topic

item.title: Help making new armour
item.dc:creator: @professionalnoob professionalnoob
item.description:
@professionalnoob wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

Do you want to use the current sprites and rename them? Bronze and Iron are the same sprites, just different colors. Or do you want something completely new?

It would honestly be easier to just reuse the ones already there. I understand itemwieldabledef, well all except the sprite part? I’m not understand where these sprite numbers are coming from. And I don’t understand animations at all lol

Read full topic

item.title: Help making new armour

@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Or you could use a handy dandy sprite editor.

Read full topic

item.title: Help making new armour
item.dc:creator: @TannerRSC TannerRSC
item.description:
@TannerRSC wrote:

If you want to use new sprites, the easiest way to find the amount of animation sprites in animations.rscd, is by extracting and opening with notepad. Then you go to the end of the file and click in the last line, then type ctrl+g to see the amount of lines. After you’ve done this open calculator and do: ((amount of lines) - 2) / 8.

Why -2?
The first and the last line aren’t part of a sprite.

Why / 8?
Because every sprite uses 8 lines.

If there aren’t added any new sprites yet, you should have 238 of them.

Now how to find a sprite that fits with your item?

E.g. You want to add a dragon kiteshield.

  1. Open itemwieldable.xml
  2. Search for the id of a rune kiteshield
  3. When you have found the rune kiteshield, you should see XXX<…
  4. Take XXX and multiplie by 8, then you know what line you have to be on.
  5. Open animations.xml and type ctrl + g, go to the line you got from last step. You should end-up at the end of the sprite you need. In this case, you should >squareshield< 6 lines above your textmarker.

How to use this sprite?

  1. Copy the whole sprite from the kiteshield and paste it after the last sprite in your animations.xml
  2. Change XXX< to the color your item needs.
  3. Save and compress the file to Animations.rscd

in itemwieldable, copy the rune kiteshield lines to the end and change XXX< to the sprite you need. Also make sure you change XXX< to the needed itemid. If there arent any items added yet, the new id should be 1290. Here you can also edit the stats of the shield. Now compress the file to Itemwieldable.xml.gz again.

Now edit itemdef.xml, copy the rune kiteshield stuff and paste it at the end of the file, don’t paste it in the middle, since the items are ordered by their id. Change the itzm name and you’re ready.

Now compress the file twice, once as Itemdef.xml.gz and once as Items.rscd

This should be it, if this doesn’t work, feel free to contact me.

Read full topic

item.title: Help making new armour
item.dc:creator: @Elfeni Elfeni
item.description:
@Elfeni wrote:

Well the .rscd file is actually just an .xml.gz file, just the ending has been changed
You may have to change your computer settings so that you can change the end part. I didn’t mean that you have to change the name to rscd.xml.gz, but from ItemDef.xml.gz to Items.rscd The files are exactly the same, just the different name.

You can test it out, just extract your .rscd files and they should open

Read full topic

item.title: Help making new armour
item.dc:creator: @professionalnoob professionalnoob
item.description:
@professionalnoob wrote:

All that sounds good. But I’m pretty sure just renaming it to .rscd is going to make it an rscd file lol

Read full topic

item.title: Help making new armour
item.dc:creator: @Elfeni Elfeni
item.description:
@Elfeni wrote:

You can either make new sprite, or use the current base sprites and just use different color for them.
The easiest way is to just use this base sprites.
Find first ItemDef.xml.gz file from your server files, you have to decompress it to get the Itemdef.xml file. Open it, and you will find there all the items in game. Then if you want to add new plate mail body, you find any ready one, copy paste it to the end of the code just like all the other items have there. Then modify its name, description, don’t touch to sprite number, set basePrice, stackable false, wieldable true, and change pictureMask numbers to make different colors. After you have added there new item, you save the file and compress it back to ItemDef.xml.gz somehow, and copy that file to client side: replace the current Items.rscd file with that ItemDef.xml.gz and rename it as Items.rscd. Then compile both server and client.

I can’t explain it better, maybe someone else can make it more accurate Good luck!

Read full topic
